item.title: Court of Appeal to hear contempt arguments over Metramac case
item.description: Metramac Corporation Sdn Bhd’s lawyer Datuk Muhammad Shafee Abdullah has been taken to task by the Court of Appeal over a complaint letter against one of the judges, Justice Gopal Sri Ram.

item.title: Lawyer, manager plead not guilty
item.description: A lawyer and her administrative manager pleaded not guilty to committing criminal breach of trust (CBT) of RM3mil belonging to Maju Holdings Sdn Bhd.

item.title: PTPTN to give out loans only for accredited courses
item.description: Beware when signing up for a course at private education institutions – from July 1, the National Higher Education Fund Corporation (PTPTN) will only give out loans for accredited courses.

item.title: Smugglers mailing drugs into the country
item.description: Drug smugglers are now mailing drugs into the country as their attempts to get individuals to bring in the substance from overseas are being foiled by the authorities.

item.title: Five-day week for banks
item.description: Banks will implement a five-day working week from Feb 1 in a bid to encourage electronic banking and give bank employees more time off.

item.title: Najem now pledges RM1m to KL Hospital
item.description: Self-proclaimed billionaire Elie Youssef Najem has now pledged RM1mil to the Kuala Lumpur Hospital.

item.title: Imagine a fish the size of a mosquito
item.description: Scientists said they had discovered the world’s tiniest fish – a species that lives in peat wetlands in South-East Asia and, when fully grown, is the size of a large mosquito.

item.title: Penang’s very own Twin Towers
item.description: The View’s selling point may be its namesake but The View is a spectacle itself due to its strong resemblance to the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur.

item.title: Fireworks explode while being disposed of
item.description: Millions of ringgit worth of confiscated fireworks exploded while they were being disposed of at the Hobart Army Camp in Jeniang, some 30km from here.

item.title: Pick right people for IPCMC
item.description: Public belief and confidence in the proposed Independent Police Complaints and Misconduct Commission (IPCMC) will hinge strongly on the selection of its members and its powers and functions.

item.title: Sex pills among smuggled items seized
item.description: Twenty-one boxes of sex stimulation pills were among RM16,115 worth of smuggled goods seized by the Kedah Anti-Smuggling Unit (UPP) in an operation here.

item.title: Fishing boats delivered to Kedah at last
item.description: Fifty-seven fishing boats built for Kedah fishermen but left exposed to the elements in Sabak Bernam, Selangor, and Hutan Melintang, Perak, have finally arrived in Kedah.

item.title: Black Metal not linked to satanism, say its fans
item.description: Black Metal, like any other type of music, is only a genre, said Joseph Prabagar, founder and director of record label Demonzend.

item.title: Pomelo is a must-have,but rainy weather has slowed ripening process
item.description: The rainy weather has slowed the ripening of pomeloes here, creating an even higher demand for the auspicious fruit during the Chinese New Year period.

item.title: Reunion dinner a way of bonding families
item.description: It is always nice to get together with loved ones but for the Chinese, the most special family gathering has to be the reunion dinner on the eve of Chinese New Year.

item.title: Good tidings via fresh blooms
item.description: Good tidings come in a package, and brightly coloured fresh flowers remain the best way to convey this during the Chinese New Year.

item.title: Police to step up enforcement during CNY
item.description: A friendly mahjong game among relatives is permissible but nothing more than two tables.

item.title: No reunion joy for some convicts
item.description: Ah Mei (not her real name) always looks forward to the reunion dinner on Chinese New Year’s eve but she has missed this significant gathering for the past three years.

item.title: Mum gets her CNY wish
item.description: A single mother is set to get her wish for the Year of the Dog – to give her children an education.

item.title: Najib inspired by dad
item.description: It did not cross Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak's mind to be actively involved in politics one day although he was a student leader during his university days in England.

item.title: Singapore names orchid after the King
item.description: A fast-growing terrestrial hybrid orchid from the Spathoglottis species was named “Spathoglottis Syed Sirajuddin” in conjunction with the visit by the Yang di-Pertuan Agong Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Syed Putra Jamalullail to Singapore’s National Orchid Garden.

item.title: RM6,000 for alligator fish
item.description: The farmer who caught the alligator gar fish last week has sold his catch to a businessman from Kuala Lumpur for RM6,000.

item.title: Man apologises for wife’s assault on discipline teacher
item.description: A former Jit Sin High School student broke down as he hugged several teachers to seek forgiveness on behalf of his wife, who had allegedly attacked a teacher with a pair of scissors.

item.title: Unusual find has villagers all excited
item.description: The usually calm and quiet village of Kampung Pengkalan Sungai Udang in Teluk Gong near here has been enveloped in excitement in recent days over an unusual find.

item.title: Transformer thieves held
item.description: A syndicate, believed to be experienced in stealing power transformers from sub-stations, has been busted with the arrest of four men.

item.title: RM2.5b in Visa card transactions
item.description: Malaysians spent RM2.48bil on their Visa cards during the holiday season from Nov 17 to Dec 31, last year – up by 17% from the corresponding period last year, according to Visa Asia Pacific.

item.title: All work and no play makes Fasha a special star
item.description: Fasha Sandha describes herself as a workaholic. The fresh-faced actress admits being hardworking and needing little beauty sleep.

item.title: Umno man suspended from party post
item.description: Kubang Kerian Umno division head Mohd Fauzi Ismail, charged with two counts of money laundering on Sunday, has been suspended from his party post.

item.title: ‘Lecturers ‘face new ‘hurdle’ to ‘promotion
item.description: University lecturers hoping to be promoted will now have to clear an extra hurdle.

item.title: Industrial training for school dropouts without SPM
item.description: School dropouts without Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia will be allowed to attend certain courses at the 21 government-run industrial training colleges.

item.title: MB determined to protect big trees
item.description: The felling of a century-old tualang tree near Taiping has sounded the alarm bells for the Terengganu government.

item.title: Sarawak using ‘fish test’ to check if rivers are clean
item.description: Sarawak has come up with guidelines for “fish indicators” – the first in the country – as a method to gauge the cleanliness of rivers.

item.title: Malaysians help raise airfare for 15 Chinese
item.description: Fifteen Chinese fishermen will get to spend Chinese New Year with their families in Hainan, China.

item.title: Swiss Alps scene shot in Genting Highlands
item.description: Genting Highlands has become the substitute setting for Switzerland in the Malaysian-made Tamil movie Ethirkaalam (The Future) which will be released in Malaysia and Singapore next month.

item.title: Rise in accident claims
item.description: Insurance companies paid out a whopping RM1.602bil in road accident claims in the first nine months of last year – 4% more than the RM1.542bil disbursed in the corresponding period in 2004.

item.title: Customs D-G gets threats via SMS
item.description: Having spent the better part of his career doing preventive work in the Customs Department, receiving threats is not something new for its director-general Datuk Abdul Rahman Abdul Hamid.

item.title: Police to get 400 more patrol cars
item.description: The public can expect more efficient patrolling and crime prevention from the police as the force is getting an additional 400 mobile patrol vehicles this year.

item.title: NS camp operator RM900,000 in arrears
item.description: The operator of a national service (NS) training camp in Rompin has come under fire from the state government for purportedly defaulting on payments to 28 suppliers.

item.title: Residents fear repeat mudslides
item.description: Impending quarry operations at Gunung Jerai have raised concerns of mudslides among nearby residents.

item.title: Defaulters’ kids barred
item.description: The offer for entry into Form 1 and 4 to Mara Junior Science Colleges (MRSM) will automatically become void if the parents or guardians of students are on Mara’s blacklist or facing legal action for failing to repay loans given by the agency.

item.title: Quit rent for some areas in Negri to rise by 200%
item.description: Quit rent for certain areas in Negri Sembilan is set to increase this year by as much as 200% following the reclassification of land use.

item.title: Keeping watch on endangered rhinos
item.description: The WWF together with the Sabah Wildlife Department and the Sabah Foundation, plan to set up a monitoring and survey team to gather information on rhinos in the state.

item.title: Girl, 15, held for drug trafficking
item.description: Three men and an underage girl, believed to be members of a drug trafficking syndicate, were arrested when a police team raided a house near Taman Temiang here about 6am on Tuesday.

item.title: Rep reports threats by in-laws
item.description: A state assemblyman lodged a police report on Tuesday claiming that his in-laws had threatened him over a family dispute.

item.title: 2 minutes news
